Artificial intelligence auditability and auditor readiness for auditing Artificial intelligence auditability and auditor readiness for auditing Making It Possible for the Auditing of AI : A Systematic Review of AI Making It Possible for the Auditing of AI : A Systematic Review of AI (PDF) Auditability of AI systems - Academia.edu\nURL: https://arxiv.org/abs/2503.04739\nSnippet: Feb 4, 2025 \u00b7 This paper explores the concept of a responsible AI system from a holistic perspective, which encompasses four key dimensions: 1) regulatory context; 2) trustworthy AI technology along with standardization and assessments; 3) auditability and accountability; and 4) AI governance. Rising concern for the societal implications of artificial intelligencesystems has inspired a wave of academic and journalistic literaturein which deployed systems are audited for harm by investigatorsfrom outside the organizations deploying the algorithms. Mar 10, 2025 \u00b7 This paper offers both a conceptual framework and practical guidance for aligning AI with values like fairness, transparency, and accountability. Trust is not given\u2014it must be designed into AI systems from the outset. This paper discusses the challenges of AI audits , including fairness and transparency, and emphasizes the importance of auditors' competencies. Based on interviews with 23 AI professionals, it proposes an AI auditability framework and required competencies. How can AI improve audit quality research? Having detailed mapping of auditability measures and auditors\u2019 competency dimensions will also facilitate AI audit quality research and provide resources for measuring AI system auditability and auditors\u2019 and audit team\u2019s competency levels. The findings of the study also have implications for the accounting information system domain. Are AI systems auditable? AI audits are expected to ensure that AI systems function lawfully, robustly, and follow ethical standards (e.g., fairness). While the auditability for financial audits and information system audits has been well addressed in the literature, auditability of AI systems has not been sufficiently addressed . Do Ai audits need auditability measures? This study systematically summarizes the current academic work and government and industrial regulations on AI audits as well as identifies auditability measures appropriate for each audit area and each specific process to be audited. The parties and persons responsible for implementing each set of auditability measures are also specified. How many research articles have been reviewed about AI audits & auditability? We reviewed 117 research articles and 23 policy and technical documents that address AI audits and AI auditability.
